Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2011 05:33PM GrammyslilButtercup wrote: Hi melinda, I waas diagnosed onMarch 17 with invasive cancer, I am not sure of the grade but was told it was agressive. My mamm and us showed a 2.3 cm lesion but no signs of malignancy so you can only imagine my surprise when a core biopsey said cancer. I have been on a rollercoater of emotions as well, i am 44 with 4 kids and a wonderful husband I am trying to be the strong one for them but then i go to work and close my door only to cry all day, I keep asking myself really? this happening. I am having a lumpectomy on Friday with lymphnode dissection, the girls on this site have given me so much encouragement. I have been told that soon when I know my treatment I will learn to breath again. I am so sorry you are travelling this road, but its only a bump, we will get through this. hang in there and I pray soon you will feel some calm and be able to breath. Big hugs coming your way, please keep us updated, and I am sure you will get some strenghth from these amazing women, I know i have xoxoxoxo Becca
Posts.Title: IDC - Histo grade 3; just waiting - forever Melinda_in_NC DanielleSurvivorSince03-09

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2011 04:43AM GrammyslilButtercup wrote: yes you do get to grieve, I have done alot of that, the last 2 days I have found some sort of calmness, I am not sure if its because my surgery date is approaching, I have never been so excited about having surgery, we have named this lil unwanted visitor "fred" and my friends and family are always asking "fred" to drop dead, so that we can all carry on without him being a constant. I know where you are at, I feel exactly how your feeling. Its a struggle to focus and do things. I still have so many fears of what to expect after and what they will tell me after they removeFred, but right now my entire focus is getting him the hell out of my body. Its weird I watch everyone around me as if its through a glass door, everyone making plans and doing things, unlimited possibilities. That will be us again soon. We have to keep our faith and move forward, we can do it together, one step at a time. Lots of hugs Melinda, Try and have a nice Sunday <3
Posts.Title: IDC - Histo grade 3; just waiting - forever Melinda_in_NC DanielleSurvivorSince03-09

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2011 10:50AM GrammyslilButtercup wrote: thinking about you today and sending hugs, lots of them. This state of confusion is such an emotional place to be. Keep us updated. Becca
Posts.Title: going crazy waiting debbsie Shirlann

Posts.Content: May 20, 2011 05:37AM GrammyslilButtercup wrote: Today is my first treatment AC . had my PICC put in yesterday, its been emotional week and I am terrified. Leaving in an hour for the hospital, thanks to all you wonderful ladies for being here. I am walking in there with some great advice. Many hugs to you all today. I hope you all have a great weekend with very few SE. I will check back in soon. Love Faith Hope <3
Posts.Title: Chemo May 2011 Cyborg

Posts.Content: May 14, 2011 05:45AM GrammyslilButtercup wrote: Hi ladies, I begin chemo May 20, scared but ready to go. 4 sessions of AC followed by 4 sessions of Taxol. Cutting my hair today, so nervous and the tears have started all over again, I am glad we have one another here for support <3 Love Hope Faith <3
